question: How to lose weight the healthy way as a 15 year old?
question_content: I'm 15 5'4 and wight 145 I wanna lose weight to be more fit healthier and happier but u need help on doing it the rite way. I don't have access to a gym so yeah

answers.answer_content: Honsetly, don't listen to people telling you to do push ups and sit ups. That's just stupid. That wont make you lose weight, that will make you get muscle. You can't target fat loss. If you have belly fat, doing crunches and sit ups will not make it go away. Your body loses fat in proportion to everything else. For example, you can't have no belly fat and have a lot of fat on your legs. It doesn't work that way. Your body will decide where to take away the fat. The best way to lose weight in a healthy way is to eat about six smaller sized meals a day instead of like three bigger ones. And as for exercises, the best way is to wear sweatpants and a sweatshirt and go running so your body can heat up to the point where it burns calories (fat). Run for about an hour a day (listening to music helps make it seem go faster or run with a friend) Hope you do well, main thing is to stick to the plan and don't procrastinate. Good luck

Ok, first of all, your still just in the healthy weight range so remember not to go too far with the whole losing weight thing. If you feel like you want to get healthy and feel good, sure, lose a few pounds but do not go below a bmi of 18.5 EVER. 
Secondly, losing weight is easy peasy. Just eat healthy foods like wholegrains, fruit, veges and low fat dairy
here is an example meal plan:
breakfast: a piece of toast with a boiled/poached egg and a skim milk coffee or tea. If you are used to having butter and can't eat toast without it, substitute it with avocado or low fat margerine spread.
morning snack: an apple
Lunch: a sandwhich with tuna and salad/ a big green garden salad with beans or tuna or skinless chicken/a can of vegetable soup with a few crackers or a piece of bread
afternoon snack: 10 nuts or a no fat yoghurt or a carrot with hommus or a skim latte
Dinner: just a smallish portion of any low fat dinner meal: think sushi, pasta, soup, shepherds pie... whatever! have it with lots of salad because its good for you and will fill you up
dessert: a piece of fruit or a skim milk hot chocolate or a no fat yoghurt

Also: if your feeling hungry in between meals munch on cucumber/carrot/celery and drink lots of water, or drink vegetable juice. Beetroot, celery carrot and ginger is so yummy together!!

BUT REMEMBER: Allow yourself a treat day where you can eat something extra- whatever you want! For example, maybe every friday have a chocolate bar dessert or a piece of cake or a pizza dinner. This way you will have something to really look forward to which will prevent you from binging out of desperation. Just remember to go straight back to your meal plan the next day.

Excercise: just do 30-40 minutes cardio (bike riding, fast paced walking or jogging) every second day, and in the days in between do strength excercises (sit ups, squats, push ups, leg lifts etc..)

This way you will lose weight steadily and surely, and you wont' feel deprived or hungry!!  Once you've reached your goal weight just slowly add more healthy food into your meals until your weight stabilises and goes neither up nor down.
Hope i helped, good luck :) x
